Reviews.Title: “Very outdated but in a convenient location, small rooms & needs renovation badly.”
Reviews.Author: Patriciaychou
Reviews.Content: I am subletting a studio apt. in Le Montfort for the summer while my children are enrolled in a language summer camp program at the College de Montreal. The location is fantastic, within walking distance to the campus. There's also a huge shopping mall 2 blocks away with free wifi, McDs, movie theater, as well as, a taxi stand always readily available. In addition, there are 4 grocery stores steps away & endless dining possibilities on Rue Ste Catherine a block away. Problem is that the bldg itself is very outdated. Besides the nice lobby & great security system (front desk guard 24/7 & keyless entry required), the units themselves are falling apart or maybe I just got unlucky. They call themselves an executive apt. but I find there are more students residing on the premises than professional businessmen. The photos on their website is very misleading though there is an indoor pool, sauna, laundry facility onsite, a gym, cleaning service at additional expense, indoor garage parking, internet & cable service as stated.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a hotel anymore!”
Reviews.Author: Larryliscious
Reviews.Content: I last stayed at the Montfort five years ago and it excellent and economical so I now that I'm planning another visit to MTL, I decided to try it again. Only problem is, they are no longer a hotel but an apartment building according to the gentleman who answered the phone. Time to update your information Trip Advisor! Jan 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I lived at Le Montfort for five months from April to August 1999 while studying in Montreal. A great place and a fantastic home away from home. The appartment was very roomy, the staff friendly and helpful, and the view from my 14th floor-terrace (and from the rooftop terrace) over Montreal and the St. Laurent are unbelieavble. I'd always come back!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is very nice..Takes a little getting use to”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I have stayed there for vacations for almost 20+ years and we noticed the changes over the years and for the most they were changes for the better. One area they could improve on is the elevator system, which is terrible. During the day the house cleaning staff use the main elevators and tie it up from guests trying to get to or from their rooms. Additionally the front desk staff don't always answer the telephone in a quick fashion probably due to low or non existant staff being at the counters. However the location is perfect for any visitor to Montreal and its a few blocks away from almost any where you would like to go. Two metros within walking distance. Main streets of Ste. Catherine & Sherbrooke a short walk away. Two shopping centers and easy access to the main highway system in Canada. Staff is very friendly, place is very clean and yeah at times there are a noisy element especially during the summer months. Pool is wonderful, sauna and weight room and well as game room available, under ground secure parking with easy access a plus. Fine eating and dinning across the street at Chez Ennios as well as your local fare of McDonals and Wendys as well as Post Office and hospitals within walking dstance. All and all a great place to stay. Highly recommend this hotel. But be prepared as I said to wait for an elevator, especially if your room is on a floor higher than Floor 8..! You couls always use the stairs...

Reviews.Title: “great family accomadations”
Reviews.Author: sharmc_11
Reviews.Content: We almost didn't stay here because of Jan.2004 review. We did and it worked out beautifully.Great location,the kids enjoyed the nearby cool stores,close to downtown, art museum,McGill.Clean rooms,handy kitchenette and separate living room from bedrooms suited different sleeping patterns. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: Bravebal
Reviews.Content: This place is horrible!! Their prices are too high and the staff was very rude..Their rooms are nothing like what they look like on their website. The place is a dump.I would never stay there again.I stayed for one night and changed hotels the next day. I paid the same price for a four star hotel just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “great stay and a great price”
Reviews.Author: Canuck123
Reviews.Content: We stayed during Grand Prix Weekend. Maid service everyday during our stay. Rooms were super clean and close proximity to a subway (about 2 blocks away).Everything was within walking distance (shopping, restaurants). Staff was fantastic. Will definitely stay there again. Parking is off site but within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room was way too hot. No way to control the heat and the bathroom sink was leaking onto the floor. Had to call receptioon 4 or 5 time to get them to properly fix the leak. They did offer a $30 rebate for the inconvenience, but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “University Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Several area universities use this location for visiting faculty, and it has had good reviews from this sort of traveler. The banging on doors at 3 am does not sound like a normal event as this location has been suggested, and is booked for professional (non-student) university conferences and training conferences for business people.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel to stay in if you want to party, yell, screem, and bang on doors all night long. This hotel seems to cater to this sort of person. Stay away if you want to sleep at 3AM. This hotel doesn't want your business.
